snippet: The investigator said he assumed that the older brother of Pope Benedict XVI knew of the abuse when he ran the Bavarian boys’ choir for 30 of the nearly 40 years covered by the inquiry.
abstract: Ulrich Weber, lawyer commissioned by Regensburg boys' choir in Bavaria, says at least 231 children in choir were physically or sexually abused over period of almost four decades; choir was led by Rev Georg Ratzinger, brother of former Pope Benedict XVI, for thirty years; mistreatment of boys is attributed primarily to Johann Meier, who died in 1992.
lead_paragraph: The investigator said he assumed that the older brother of Pope Benedict XVI knew of the abuse when he ran the Bavarian boys’ choir for 30 of the nearly 40 years covered by the inquiry.

headline.main: Over 200 Members of German Choir Were Abused, Investigator Says
headline.print_headline: More Than 200 Boys in German Choir Were Abused Over Decades, Lawyer Says
